alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 9:42AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. .The Buffalo River has begun to rise in response to ongoing rainfall. A rise into major flood stage in the next 24 hours. This forecast takes into account previous precipitation and forecast precipitation through 7 AM Sunday. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Buffalo River near Hawley. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. Railroad underpass at US Hwy 10 floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight and continue rising to a crest of 9.5 feet early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
